result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael John Schouten was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to meet with payment clerk.
DNA surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael John Schouten

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: c: Def, Atty, DA, GWC PD & Jail. eif
DE appeared.  DE to pay bal in full within 60 days.  DE signed PPA. jaf
signed by Def & Atty this date. eif

TO ALSO INCLUDE 15CM283, 15FO148, 15TR2561, 15TR2562 and 15TR2563: 
CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Joel Kenneth Larimore   DF:  Michael John Schouten appeared. Case called at 2:50 p.m. ADA Nieskes gives recommendations. Atty Larimore in agreement.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to 15CM283. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of 15CM283. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses 15FO148, 15TR2561, 15TR2562 and 15TR2563 in their entirety. Sentencing arguments. Defendant makes statement.  Crt orders:

-  3 Day Jail Sentence. 3 Days Credit. TIME SERVED.

- Misdemeanor court costs $243.00. Meet with payment clerk

- DNA Sample and surcharge

TO ALSO INCLUDE 15CM283, 15FO148, 15TR2561, 15TR2562 and 15TR2563:
CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA: Michael Nieskes DF ATTY:  Joel Kenneth Larimore   DF:  Michael John Schouten appeared. Case called at 11:35 a.m. Motion filed by Atty Larimore on Motion to Suppress Evidence. ADA Nieskes calls Chief Darwin to the stand. S/T Robert Darwin Chief of Police for Glenwood City. Direct by ADA Nieskes. Witness identifies defendant in the courtroom. Cross by Atty Larimore. Witness excused. State rests. Atty Larimore has no evidence. Atty Larimore requesting time to submit a brief. Court denies request. Atty Larimore makes argument. ADA Nieskes argues. Court at this time will deny defendant's motion to suppress. Address confirmed. Bond continues.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 15CM283, 15FO148, 15TR2561, 15TR2562 and 15TR2563:
  CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Francis D. Collins   DF ATTY:  Joel Kenneth Larimore   DF:  Michael J Schouten appeared. Case called at 10:16 a.m. Atty Larimore states a motion has been filed on 15CM283 and need a motion date scheduled. Court enters NG pleas on 15FO148, 15TR2561, 15TR2562 and 15TR2563. Address confirmed. Bond continues in form and amount. hml  Motion hearing scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 11:30 am.
Notice of Motion to Suppress Statements and to Suppress Evidence. Filed by Atty Andrea. km
From JA to parties. Re: appointment of counsel. km
Status conference on June 30, 2015 at 10:15 am.

records.addlTxt: for Judge filed by Atty Andrea. eif

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

CO; CAR for EFV, RPT, Erin Drost, Clerk; E. Ferrill, ADA:   Michael E. Nieskes,  DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea,  DF:  Michael John Schouten appeared from jail. Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Reserves speedy trial. Request a substitution for Judge.
